This was the first game I ever played during my childhood (I was about 4 years old and yes I remember). 
In my first "play-through," I couldn't even get past the Akira elevator level. I was still fascinated by the map and story, so I saw a lot of potential to continue trying. Now that I'm older, I could finally play this game correctly. I started a new game on hard with the assumption that it's old, hence it must be easy. However, I literally spent ten hours trying to beat this game--and it was worth it. Every second of this game has world building, puzzles, and challenging AI. The Half-Life universe is a wonderful creation. I hope I won't be dead by the time the third installment arrives.

I did okay in HL2 and the two sequels.
Sometimes it was a little bit hard, but not that much, really. I played it on various difficulties and it was still okay.
I loved it sooooo much I bought the first one.

Half-life was the first game that I properly remember playing. It was given to me by a friend when I was in Grade 5 and I remember playing until the first part of 'Residue Processing'. By that time, holidays were over and my friend had entered the Xen world and I was full of awe when I saw him playing in a low-gravity world with alien weapons. I decided to return back to Half-life. But alas, I had to move houses and with the passage of time and age, I somehow forgot to continue playing Half-life.

Then surprise surprise I saw the half-life pack on a steam sale. No second questions were asked and I immediately bought the pack. I had to finish this game. With its outdated graphics and linear gameplay, I wouldn't be surprised if people thought Minecraft 'looked' better than Half-life. But let me tell you, there is no other game (aside from Half-life 2) that could even come close to the brilliance of its gameplay. The storyline and the gameplay itself is revolutionary and not many games today can even compare to the shooter known as Half-life.

I shall always remember today (15th August 2016) as the day that I finally finished the original Half-life after 14 years. Thank you Valve for making the game that introduced me to the world of gaming.

I can finally sleep in peace before I move onto another masterpiece known as Half-life 2.
didnt play it much but recommend it

One of the few near flawless games ever made, Half Life admitedly does have some frustrating and rather dated niggles, which I'll bring up before anything else. The platforming is actually quite bad. It never works that well in first person unless climbing mechanics are made entirely contextual. In Half Life, of course, nothing is contextual and you are in complete control of Freeman at all times. When the numerous platforming sections come around, though, the game feels extremely sensitive and you are expected to jump and land onto some really ridiculously narrow platforms to progress. It becomes a real exercise in frustration, and trial and error is often the only way of knowing whether or not Freeman will land on the platform or fall right to his doom. I guess the creation of such an impressive physics engine means that the developers will make it their civic duty to show it off as much of it as feasible in the game. It's just that Valve took a little too much liberty in showing it off in Half Life. 

As I've said before, Half Life is a near flawless game, let down only by it's jumping sections. Ignoring those, and you should, this is one of the very best FPSs ever made, possibly THE greatest FPS game ever made. It's ridiculously good. The worldbuilding is astonishingly lifelike, the aliens quirky and instantly iconic thanks to their imaginative designs, the weapon selection is marvellous and transformed the straightforward crowbar into a symbol of gaming culture and the story is one of the strongest in gaming. Seriously, the feeling of being part of a grand conspiracy far greater than your own understanding, together with being the unwitting hero tasked to save the world from an alien invasion and travelling through the chaos happening all around you makes for a rip-roaring roller coaster of a game that never gets boring or repetitive, well, ever really. 

Gunplay is appropriately meaty and cathartic, yet with an added sense of realism that you didn't find with other FPS classics like Quake and Doom. I rate this game better than Half Life 2, on the grounds that the gameplay is just as good but the story can be treated as one holistic story rather than the mere beginnings of a grander story planned to be told in something like, say, erm a TRILOGY. Yeah it basically boils down to Half Life 1 not ending on a cliffhanger which will likely never be resolved, as it's sequel did. 

So yeah, buy Half Life if you haven't already, experience one of the few games that can truly be called a 'Citizen Kane of Gaming' and don't read THAT much into the greater plot going on. That way, you can feel wholly satisfied with everything this amazing game offers and not go mad waiting for the final chapter to be released sometime in the next 3000 years.

9.5/10

Una de las más grandes joyas de la industria de los videojuegos. Si por alguna razón, desconoces, dudas o no has podido probar la calidad de Half-Life, te invito a que inviertas los centavos necesarios en él. Descubrí esta saga en 2012 y con mucha facilidad se convirtió en mi favorita, tanto por su jugabilidad, como por la brillante manera de contar su historia. Sin duda alguna, si alguien me pidiera recomendar algún juego, sin duda alguna esta saga sería la primera en venir a mi pensamiento.
¡Juegazo!

В общей сложность я потратил на нее больше 10 часов, чтобы завалить несложного босса, также потратил немного нервов и тд. и тп. Напишу плисы и минусы игры:
Плюсы:
Ностальгия
Неплохой сюжет(что для шутера это большой плюс)
Минусы:
Запутанные игровые лабиринты(иногда непонятно что делать и куда идти)

[b]Video oyunları arasında adeta mihenk taşı vazifesi gören, kendinden sonra çıkan oyunlara esin kaynağı olan ve oyuncular arasında sevmeyeninin hor görüldüğü bir oyunla, [url=https://store.steampowered.com/publisher/valve/list/7]Half-Life[/url] serisinin güzide ilk oyunu ile beraberiz. Öncelikle hikâyemiz, Black Mesa adı verilen gizli bir tesiste başlıyor. Gordon Freeman isminde bir MIT profesörünü canlandırdığımız bu başarılı kariyer, yanlış giden bir deney sonucu yerle bir oluyor ve Xen adı verilen öte-evren'den içerisinde bulunduğumuz tesise yoğun bir uzaylı istilası başlıyor. Anlayacağınız üzere, bu tesisten kurtulup olanları tüm dünyaya, tüm şeffaflığıyla anlatmak için elimizden gelen her şeyi yapacağımıza ekip arkadaşlarımıza söz veriyoruz. Bu süreçte karşımıza yaratıklar kadar zombileştirilmiş iş arkadaşlarımız ve hatta devlet tarafından herkesi öldürmek için görevlendirilmiş askerler bile çıkacak diyebilirim. Diğer noktalarına bakarsak, yapım grafiksel olarak çıkış yaptığı yıla göre fazlasıyla başarılı zira 1998 senesinde sunulduğunu düşünürsek yani ortalama yirmi beş yıllık bir oyun olduğunu düşünürsek son derece mükemmel desem abartmış olmam. Oynanış mekanikleri açısından da gerçekten akıcı ve tatmin edici düzeyde bir oynanış sunuyor. Bu anlattıklarım haricinde oyunun en sevdiğim, en bayıldığım yapımlar arasında ilk beş içerisinde olacağını da söyleyebilirim. Sözün kısası sevgili oyuncular, eğer hâlâ [url=https://store.steampowered.com/publisher/valve/list/7]Half-Life[/url] evrenine giriş yapmamış nadir insanlardansanız veyahut biraz nostalji damarlarınızı kabartmak istiyorsanız kütüphanenize eklemenizi ve denemenizi kesinlikle ama kesinlikle tavsiye ederim.

Not: İnceleme içerisinde bahsettiğim tesise gelen askerlerden birisini, yine Valve'ın oyunlarından birisi olan [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/50/HalfLife_Opposing_Force/]Half-Life: Opposing Force[/url]'da oynama imkânı elde ediyoruz. Eğer ilginizi çekiyorsa veyahut hikâyeyi farklı bir açıdan deneyimlemek istiyorsanız ve eğer oyun hakkındaki düşüncelerimi merak ediyorsanız [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/charewofficial/recommended/50?snr=1_5_9__402]inceleme yazıma[/url] göz gezdirebilirsiniz.

06.03.2020 tarihli güncelleme notu: Eğer güncel grafiklerle ve mekaniklerle [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/70/HalfLife/]Half-Life[/url] efsanesini tekrardan deneyimlemek istiyorsanız, [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/362890/Black_Mesa/]Black Mesa[/url] adındaki fan yapımı muazzam oyuna göz atmanızı ve fikir edinmek istiyorsanız [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/charewofficial/recommended/362890?snr=1_5_9__402]inceleme yazımı[/url] okumanızı öneririm, iyi oyunlar!

Daha fazla inceleme için;
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/28040015[/b]

Személy szerint a legmeghatározóbb videojátékomként tartom számon a Half-Life-ot. Ez nem azért van, mert hibátlan lenne ez az alkotás, hanem azért, mert számomra gyerekkorra visszamenő élményeket nyújtott egy olyan korban, amikor mással nem is akartam játszani. Objektívan nézve, a Half-Life egy 9/10-es játék. De mivel nem tudok elvonatkoztatni attól, hogy végeredményében  a Half-Life volt az a játék, ami elindított a videojátékok megismerésének rögös útján, átlépek a hibáin, és Tökéletes jelzővel illetem. Ez az a pont, amikor az objektív szemléletemet felülírja a szubjektív.

So what is Half-Life? Well it's got a simple story: You work in an underground research facility and some stuff goes wrong, unleashing aliens into the facility. You try and fight your way out to the surface but the military comes in with grunts and ninjas forcing you back undeground. There a team of scientists transports you to the alien homeworld where you kill an oversized fetus. This weird guy with a briefcase turns up and offers you a job. You accept and the game ends on a cliffhanger.

Half-Life's gameplay is set up in a way that there are no cutscenes. You are in control of Gordon Freeman from beginning to end. It's this gameplay feature that makes this game special, makes it stand out from the crowd as a revolutuionary rollercoaster of epicness. It's not all combat though, sometimes you'll have to navigate puzzles and while that may turn off some players, they're not that bad. Most of the time there will be enemies to keeps you on your toes so be careful!

This is my favourite game of all time, been playing it since I was a kid. I'd definetley recommend it to fans of FIrst-Person Shooters.

10/10

I recently had the chance to replay all of the Half Life Games, which I promptly did in a weeks time. I'll get to it.

GRAPHICS: Laughable for today, but pretty impressive for the time. If I was alive then, it would have blown my mind. 90/100.

AUDIO: Gravely, not the most impressive, even for the time, but not horrible. 84/100.

GAMEPLAY: Revolutionary. Set the standard. 100/100.

STORY: Very immersive for the time, and surprisingly open-ended. Very good. 95/100.

In general, very good, and a revolutionary game for all time. 92.25/100.

Half Life (1998) is a classic for not only the FPS genre, but also to gaming in general. It was one of the first pioneers to have realistic and open ended level design and realistic/immersive atmosphere. 
The game's graphics haven't aged very well, but thankfully the game comes installed with the HD pack, which updates weapon models and come NPCs to make them look crisper and not robot like. 
But what really makes this game a classic is the gameplay and atmosphere. The gameplay is a mix of Run'n'Gun of older games (Doom, Quake) and the more realistic style of modern shooters. The balance of the enemies you will face on your journey is remarkable. They are tough, but the bullets you have to kill them seem about right. It is fun and with addition weapons you will get later makes it even more fun.
The A.I. of the soldier are also remarkable. They actually act as if they are soldiers in a squad, with them flanking and throwing grenades to weed you out. 
The immersion of the facility you will be playing through is probably the best thing about this game. On my first playthrough, I barely noticed the story or stopped playing because I was so ingrossed. I think the limited graphics actually help the game here.
My only problem with this game are it's last couple levels. If you've ever played the game, you know what section I'm talking about. If you haven't, just remember that the ending is worth it.

Experience the original masterpiece of a game.

Have a taste of the original first person shooter with a story completely based on scripted events, which became the catalyst for the creation of Counter Strike, The Ship, Natural Selection, and arguably Team Fortress (even though TF existed in the Quake engine before). 

If you're coming from Half Life 2 and wondering how this game is different, the main difference really is that this game does not hold your fucking hand. Prepare for pure hell to be unleashed onto you as you realize that the easiest difficulty in this game is harder than the hardest difficulty in Half Life 2. Cower in fear as enemies that take a quarter of your ammunition to kill charge you from every direction. Be confused as you end up in mazes with no idea of where the fuck you're supposed to go and deathtraps awaiting you if you make the wrong turn. 

Oh and get to fight a giant testicle attached to a 20 foot tall armored spider. 

Ultimately, if you're up to the challenge, I highly recommend this entertaining masterpiece of a game!

This 1990s game is an amazing game full of heaps of weapons like : Glock 17/ m9 Berreta, spas-12 (shotgun), mp5sd/ m4 carbine w/ m203 grenade launcher, crossbow, RPG, frag grenade, laser claymore, mobile C4 charge and detonator and of course a crowbar.
It honestly gets pretty addictive and gives a refreshing challenge.

This game is great to play just as a lore prequel to Half Life 2,or for it's incredibly fun gameplay. Looking past it's 1998 graphics, this game brings a ton to the table, and is definitely in my top 5. It's a beautiful melding of puzzles and problem solving with the rush of other first person shooters. You should totally buy this game, even at full price. Enjoy!
